description.narrative:
PLEASE REVIEW YOUR ANSWER AS THE QUESTION HAS BEEN CHANGED
Ambassaden har sedan 2004 haft en årlig program- och metodutvecklingsinsats, med syfte att stärka beredning, uppföljning och utvärdering av insatser och därigenom bidra till ökad kompetens inom utvecklingssamarbetet med Mocambique.
Ett antal förberedande och stödjande enskilda uppdrag finansieras ur fonden, exempelvis bakgrundsstudier inför en ny beredning, av en ny partner, ett nytt område eller en ny metod. Uppdragen kan också beröra utvärderingar eller uppföljningsrelaterade studier, revisioner eller granskningar när sådana inte budgeterats för i den specifika insatsen.
Uppdragen ska vara relevanta för strategimål eller motsvarande samt vara förenliga med av regeringen beslutade styrande dokument för biståndet och Sidas verksamhetsplan.
Varje enskild komponent bör inte överskrida en tidsram på sex månader och ska vara begränsad i sin utformning, samt vara kopplad till tydliga resultat.
Varje uppdrag skall; (i) beslutas om i ett separat beslut (ii) handläggas av ansvarig handläggare, både gällande draft av beslut/kontrakt/ToR osv, finansiella transaktioner och resultatuppföljning

The embassy has since 2004 had an annual contribution for program- and method development, with the aim of strengthening the preparation, monitoring and evaluation of interventions and thereby contribute to increased competence in development cooperation with Mozambique.
A number of preparatory and supportive individual assignments are financed from the fund, such as background studies of a new partner, of a new area or of a new method. Assignments such as evaluations or follow-up related studies, audits or reviews can also be financed from the fund.
The assignments shall be relevant to the objectives in the strategy or equivalent and be consistent with the governing documents for aid decided by the Government as well as with Sida's operational plan.
The assignments/components should not exceed a period of six months and shall be limited in their design, as well as being linked to clear results.
Each assignment will; (i) be determined in a separate decision (ii) have a separate component in this contribution (PUM) (iii) be dealt with by the officer in charge, both regarding the draft Decision / contract / ToR, etc., the financial transactions and the performance monitoring

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The purpose of a Programme Development Fund (PUM), that was put in place yearly between 2004 and 2015, was to enhance the quality of programme preparations, as well as follow-up through monitoring consultants, audits and evaluation. The PUM 2015 was active between 2015-02-01 and 2016-12-30 and the final contribution of the kind at the Embassy of Maputo and Finance code 106070200 Mocambique. Eligible activities to be financed through the PUM was the background studies, shorter Technical Assistance to partners, evaluations and monitoring, as well as seminars, publications and translations. The PUM 2015 consisted of 13 components, out of which 10 actually were used. Each assignment/activity was decided upon in separate decisions, having their own components in PLUS/PLANit and with the respective Programme Officer responsible for following up the financial transactions and outputs for his/her component. The PUM 2015 was of SEK 4 500 000 and had an outcome of SEK 2 375 944. The activities financed through the PUM 2015 were to the largest extent audits (~800 tkr) and follow-up of partners through consultants (~346 tkr), as well as technical assistance to a partner (~382 tkr). Other costs were for preparatory studies (~495 tkr) and seminars (~350 tkr) where the topics for example were to prepare for a contributuion within climat change and an internal workshop on procurement.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
